thread.title: Mets' Ruben Tejada will not need surgery for broken leg
thread.title_full: Mets' Ruben Tejada will not need surgery for broken leg

author: Mike Vorkunov | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Mets' Ruben Tejada will not need surgery for broken leg
text:
Comments 
NEW YORK â€” Ruben Tejada will not need surgery to mend his broken leg , the Mets say. 
Tejada suffered a non-displaced fractured right fibula in Game 2 of the National League Division Series against the Dodgers when Chase Utley slid into him and toppled him. Tejada had to be carried off the field. 
Tejada batted .261 with a .688 OPS this season and was the team's starting shortstop entering the postseason . 
The Mets will now have to replace him. Wilmer Flores will become the team's starting shortstop. Matt Reynolds will take his place on the roster . He has never played in the majors. 
To make room for Reynolds on the 40-man roster, the Mets designated pitcher Tim Stauffer for assignment.
